overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to forecasting a short time-series (96 hourly points) with clear daily seasonality. The analyst evaluates multiple methods (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing, weighted averaging) but ultimately selects a simple seasonal naive approach due to data limitations, emphasizing recency and simplicity while acknowledging trade-offs in accuracy.
common_data_patterns: Intraday pattern (highs at midnight, morning lows, evening recovery)
No missing values in provided data
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) constrains complex model usage despite identified seasonality
Recency prioritization (last day's pattern favored over historical averages)
Trade-off between simplicity (naive method) and sophistication (Exponential Smoothing/SARIMA) due to data length
Explicit handling of multi-step forecasting (96-hour horizon) through pattern repetition
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Detailed evaluation of statistical methods with data-driven justification, but reverts to simple heuristics due to practical constraints.
